org.dockbox.selene.database

Interface ISQLMan<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the target database source
    All Superinterfaces:
    InjectableType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SQLiteMan, SQLMan

    public interface ISQLMan<T>
extends InjectableType
    Low-level interface for communicating with SQL databases.

      • getTable

        Table getTable(java.lang.String name)
        throws InvalidConnectionException
        Gets a table from the database and converts it to the internal Table type. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table as defined in the database.
        Returns:
        The table
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database

      • getTable

               T target)
        throws InvalidConnectionException
        Gets a table from the database and converts it to the internal Table type.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table as defined in the database.
        target - The target database source
        Returns:
        The table
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database

      • getTableSafe

        Exceptional<Table> getTableSafe(java.lang.String name)
        Attempts to get a table from the database and converts it to the internal Table type wrapped in a Exceptional. If the table does not exist, or no connection could be made to the database, Exceptional.empty() is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table as defined in the database.
        Returns:
        The table wrapped in a Exceptional, or Exceptional.empty()

      • getTableSafe

        Exceptional<Table> getTableSafe(java.lang.String name,
                                T target)
        Attempts to get a table from the database and converts it to the internal Table type wrapped in a Exceptional. If the table does not exist, or no connection could be made to the database, Exceptional.empty() is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table as defined in the database.
        target - The target database source
        Returns:
        The table wrapped in a Exceptional, or Exceptional.empty()

      • store

        void store(java.lang.String name,
           Table table)
    throws InvalidConnectionException
        Stores a table to the database under a given name. Depending on the implementation this may update a existing table, or create a new one. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table in the database
        table - The table to store
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - the invalid connection exception

      • store

           java.lang.String name,
           Table table)
    throws InvalidConnectionException

        Parameters:

        target - The target database source

      • store

        void store(java.lang.String name,
           Table table,
           boolean reset)
    throws InvalidConnectionException
        Stores a table to the database under a given name. If a table already exists it will be dropped and recreated depending on the given argument. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table in the database
        table - The table to store
        reset - Whether or not to drop a table if it already exists
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database

      • store

        void store(T target,
           java.lang.String name,
           Table table,
           boolean reset)
    throws InvalidConnectionException
        Stores a table to the database under a given name. If a table already exists it will be dropped and recreated depending on the given argument. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table in the database
        table - The table to store
        reset - Whether or not to drop a table if it already exists
        target - The target database source
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database

      • drop

        void drop(java.lang.String name)
   throws InvalidConnectionException
        Drops a table on the database if it exists. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table to drop
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database

      • deleteIf

        <C> void deleteIf(java.lang.String name,
                  ColumnIdentifier<C> identifier,
                  C value)
           throws InvalidConnectionException
        Deletes a set of rows from a table if they meet a certain value on a given column. Uses the default or no target, depending on the implementation.
        Type Parameters:
        C - The type constraint for the identifier and value
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table
        identifier - The column identifier
        value - The matching value
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database

      • deleteIf

        <C> void deleteIf(T target,
                  java.lang.String name,
                  ColumnIdentifier<C> identifier,
                  C value)
           throws InvalidConnectionException
        Deletes a set of rows from a table if they meet a certain value on a given column.
        Type Parameters:
        C - The type constraint for the identifier and value
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the table
        identifier - The column identifier
        value - The matching value
        target - The target database source
        Throws:
        InvalidConnectionException - If no connection could be prepared to the database
